Literature Review: CRISPR-based biosensing strategies have emerged as a rapidly evolving technology, leveraging the unique properties of the CRISPR-Cas system to develop innovative biosensing approaches. The core biochemical properties of CRISPR-Cas systems, including diverse reaction temperatures, programmability in design, high reaction efficiency, and recognition specificity, provide a solid foundation for the development of new-generation biosensing strategies. Recent efforts have focused on improving these parameters to enhance the sensitivity and quantification capabilities of CRISPR-based biosensors.
